intro: Centaurium pulchellum subsp. grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
